t: Jeremiah 20
Jeremiah and Pashhur
When*p the priest Pashhur son of Immer, the official in charge of the temple of the Lord,*s heard Jeremiah prophesying these things,
he had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and put in the stocks at the Upper Gate of Benjamin at the Lord’s*s temple.
The next day, when Pashhur released him from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “The Lord’s*s name for you is not Pashhur, but Terror on Every Side.

For this is what the Lord*s says: ‘I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends; with your own eyes you will see them fall by the sword of their enemies. I will give all Judah into the hands of the king of Babylon, who will carry them away to Babylon or put them to the sword.

I will deliver all the wealth of this city into the hands of their enemies—all its products, all its valuables and all the treasures of the kings of Judah. They will take it away as plunder and carry it off to Babylon.
And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house will go into exile to Babylon. There you will die and be buried, you and all your friends to whom you have prophesied lies.’ ”
Jeremiah’s Complaint
You*pn deceived me, Lord,*s and I was deceived; you*ld overpowered me and prevailed. I*ln am ridiculed all day long; everyone*ld mocks me.
Whenever*ln I speak, I cry out proclaiming*ld violence and destruction. So*ln the word of the Lord*s has brought me insult*ld and reproach all day long.

But*ln if I say, “I will not mention his word or*ld speak anymore in his name,” his*ln word is in my heart like a fire, a*ld fire shut up in my bones. I*ln am weary of holding it in; indeed,*ld I cannot.

I*ln hear many whispering, “Terror*ld on every side! Denounce*ld him! Let’s denounce him!” All*ln my friends are*ld waiting for me to slip, saying, “Perhaps*ln he will be deceived; then*ld we will prevail over him and*ld take our revenge on him.”
But*pn the Lord*s is with me like a mighty warrior; so*ld my persecutors will stumble and not prevail. They*ln will fail and be thoroughly disgraced; their*ld dishonor will never be forgotten.
Lord*sln Almighty, you who examine the righteous and*ld probe the heart and mind, let*ln me see your vengeance on them, for*ld to you I have committed my cause.
Sing*pn to the Lord!*s Give*ld praise to the Lord!*s He*ln rescues the life of the needy from*ld the hands of the wicked.
Cursed*pn be the day I was born! May*ld the day my mother bore me not be blessed!
Cursed*ln be the man who brought my father the news, who*ld made him very glad, saying, “A*ld child is born to you—a son!”
May*ln that man be like the towns the*ld Lord*s overthrew without pity. May*ln he hear wailing in the morning, a*ld battle cry at noon.
For*ln he did not kill me in the womb, with*ld my mother as my grave, her*ld womb enlarged forever.
Why*ln did I ever come out of the womb to*ld see trouble and sorrow and*ld to end my days in shame?
